metadata.Title: CVE-2017-3169 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Apache httpd 2.2.x before 2.2.33 and 2.4.x before 2.4.26, mod_ssl may dereference a NULL pointer when third-party modules call ap_hook_process_connection() during an HTTP request to an HTTPS port.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3169` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.3
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.3
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.3
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.3
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.3
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.3').
